item.title: Book 1: Artifical Intelligence
item.description: This book is very interseting read as an AI enthusiast. Here is the summary of the book: A lot of general application today that are AI embedded ironically are not labeled as AI because of the application’s pervasive use throught several industries. Throught the histroy, complexities of human minds, nature of thought,and possibility of AI has been a facinating topic that aroused scientist, philosopers, artists, and even theologians. The characterization of human like artificial beings in the movies, literature, myth, art, music, and games that depict emotional robots with advanced intelligence speaks to human’s interest in the artifical beings.

item.title: Current inflation in US and how it got to this point
item.description: This is a follow up from my last post about inflation. Now I will examine the current state of US Housing market and its future. US housing market is an interesting for me because I work very closely as a data scientist for a real estate company backed by one of the largest asset management company (prefer not to disclose). Over my time spent working, I got very interested in the state of the housing market, its history and implications for the future.

item.title: Current inflation in US and how it got to this point
item.description: A brewing concerns lately regading the state of US economy predicted to be headed to recession. Over the past few months, the market experts, economist and the Fed's sentiment of inflation went from being a transitory to little push back to acceptance that it is a real problem. Alomst like a person finding out about a serious underlying issue who go through similar phrase of denial to acceptance. The Feds response to the scorching inflation by raising rates as not really helped as evidenced by the latest CPI for the month of May 2020 which was as high as 8.

item.title: Book 3: Three Things Sucessful People Do
item.description: The Journey is more fun if you know where you are going. It is often hard to define sucess. If you do not know what sucess is, how will you acheive it? One common definiton that works for everyone is: sucess is a journey. Wrong picture of sucess Wealth Special Feeling Specific and Worthwhile Possessions Power Achievement Right Picture of Sucess Two things are required: Right picture of sucess and Right principles of getting there.

item.title: Book 2: Reinventing The Body, Resurrecting The Soul
item.description: Reinventing The Body, Resurrecting The Soul - Deepak Chopra The forgotten miracle - Life is meant to be a complete experience. People keep struggling with problems both physical and mental, never suspecting the root: that the bond between body and soul has been severed. Reinventing your body: You, right at this minute, stand at the growing tip of evolution. The next thing you think, the next action you take, will either create a new possibility for you or it will repeat the past.

item.title: Lex Friedman's podcast with Saifedean Ammous
item.description: Some notes from Lex Friedman Podcast: Money - market goods, medium of transaction, saving the most liquid goods with least uncertainity, best tech to move value into the future. Hard money vs Soft money - money is whatever is hardest to make, prision use cigrattes, culmilated in end of 19th centuary to gold standard. gold can’t be destroyed, stockpiles bigger (inflation), second hardest silver. hard and soft is based on supply and how easy suoply can be increased.

item.title: Top lessons I learnt from Kobe Bryant
item.description: Kobe Bryant, one of the greatest basketball players of all time, is my huge source of inspiration. I wasn’t very involved in basketball until I moved to the US. I first played basketball with a few friends when I was in college and I loved it so much that it quickly became my favorite sport. As a result, I became more immersed in the sport by watching the NBA games and generally learning more about them.

item.title: Book 1: How to think about Exercise
item.description: In this post, I will summarize key lessons that I derived from reading the book as titled above. I am planning for similar series of posts for most the books I will be reading in the future. How to think about Exercise - Daemon Young The body and mind are not separate entities as some philosophers in the early era claimed. The supposed dualism does not really exist. The mind and body function as a single entity.

item.title: Virtue Signaling and Cancel Culture in Today's Society
item.description: Note: For those unfamiliar with the issue, this article involves a discussion about recent criticism of Chamath’s seemingly nonchalant stance on Chinese treatment of the Uyghurs Community. For more context, checkout: BBC’s article. Recently, Chamath’s (CEO of Social Capital) notoriously dismissive remarks on the Uyghurs community made at All-in podcast had drawn quite a lot of mainstream media backlash which led me to ruminate on where I stand on the human rights issues and how as a society we should go about tackling this problem.

Explicit is better than implicit; Errors should never pass silently, unless explicitly silenced. I’ve spent the first half of my twenties as a student, analyst and a data scientist. I have travelled across the US except the west which I am aiming to explore in 2022, getting to blogging and an aspiring book worm. I’m currently thinking about: Software Design and Principles Complex data analytical techniques Blockchain and Cryptocurrencies Anonymous internet personas in the age of cancel culture Economics and Stock Market New applications for risk diversification If you’re also interested in the above topics, have feedback on my writing, or just want to say hello, please get in touch.

Nischal Subedi Data Scientist [ website ] . [ linkedin ] . [ github ] Hello! I am a data scientist with a background in credit card and real estate analytics. I have worked on several projects that involved researching new algorithms to tackle tough problems, analyzing complex, and poorly structured datasets, building novel production ETL and ML infrastructures and bringing intelligent capabilities to fruition for users. One of the interesting projects I have worked on recently involved building an infrastructure to constantly monitor micro-markets using live feeds.
